items.title: Propagation-of-Chaos Mass Concentration
items.content:
2743: :label: prop-poc-mass
2744: 
2745: Let $\mu_t^N$ be the empirical measure of the $N$-walker Euclidean Gas and $\rho_t$ the solution of the McKean-Vlasov PDE with the same initial data. Then for every $t > 0$ and every $\epsilon > 0$ there exist constants $C_{\text{pc}}, \beta_{\text{pc}} > 0$ (depending on $t$ and the physical parameters but not on $N$) such that
2746: 
2747: $$
2748: \mathbb{P}\left( \sup_{0 \leq s \leq t} \left| \|\mu_s^N\|_{L^1} - \|\rho_s\|_{L^1} \right| > \epsilon \right)
2749: \leq C_{\text{pc}} \exp\!\left( - \beta_{\text{pc}} N \epsilon^2 \right).
2750: $$
2751: 
2752: **Proof**:
2753: 
2754: Write $k_s := N \|\mu_s^N\|_{L^1}$ for the number of alive walkers. The proof has two components.
2755: 
2756: **Step 1: Mean-field bias control**  
2757: Section 3 of `07_mean_field.md` (see Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-mean-field-limit-informal` and the quantitative estimates in its proof) yields
2758: 
2759: $$
2760: \left| \mathbb{E}\left[\frac{k_s}{N}\right] - \|\rho_s\|_{L^1} \right| \leq \frac{C_{\text{bias}}(t)}{N}
2761: \qquad \forall s \in [0, t],
2762: $$
2763: 
2764: where $C_{\text{bias}}(t)$ depends continuously on $t$ and the model parameters. This follows from the classical propagation-of-chaos estimates (Fournier & Méléard 2004, Theorem 1.1), because the birth/death rates are globally Lipschitz on the compact phase space.
2765: 
2766: **Step 2: Martingale concentration for $k_s$**  
2767: The Doob decomposition of $k_s$ reads
2768: 
2769: $$
2770: \frac{k_s}{N} = \frac{k_0}{N} + M_s + \int_0^s \left( \lambda_{\text{rev}} \frac{N - k_r}{N} - \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N c(z_r^{(i)}) \right) dr,
2771: $$
2772: 
2773: where $M_s$ is a càdlàg martingale with jumps bounded by $1/N$. The predictable quadratic variation satisfies
2774: 
2775: $$
2776: \langle M \rangle_s \leq \frac{(\lambda_{\text{rev}} + c_{\max}) s}{N} =: \frac{\Lambda s}{N}.
2777: $$
2778: 
2779: Freedman’s inequality for martingales with bounded jumps (Freedman 1975) therefore gives, for any $\eta > 0$,
2780: 
2781: $$
2782: \mathbb{P}\left( \sup_{0 \leq r \leq s} |M_r| \geq \eta \right)
2783: \leq 2 \exp\!\left( - \frac{N \eta^2}{2(\Lambda s + \eta)} \right)
2784: \leq 2 \exp\!\left( - \frac{N \eta^2}{4 \Lambda t + 2} \right)
2785: = 2 \exp\!\left( - \beta_{\text{mart}} N \eta^2 \right),
2786: $$
2787: 
2788: for all $s \leq t$, where $\beta_{\text{mart}} := \big(4 \Lambda t + 2\big)^{-1}$.
2789: 
2790: **Step 3: Union bound and choice of parameters**  
2791: For any $\epsilon > 0$,
2792: 
2793: $$
2794: \left\{ \sup_{0 \leq s \leq t} \left| \frac{k_s}{N} - \|\rho_s\|_{L^1} \right| > \epsilon \right\}
2795: \subseteq \left\{ \sup_{0 \leq s \leq t} |M_s| > \frac{\epsilon}{2} \right\}
2796: \cup \left\{ \sup_{0 \leq s \leq t} \left| \mathbb{E}\left[\frac{k_s}{N}\right] - \|\rho_s\|_{L^1} \right| > \frac{\epsilon}{2} \right\}.
2797: $$
2798: 
2799: The bias term is zero whenever $\epsilon \geq 2 C_{\text{bias}}(t)/N$, and otherwise it contributes at most the trivial probability $1 \leq e^{\beta_{\text{mart}} N \epsilon^2}$, which we absorb into the constant $C_{\text{pc}}$. Combining the two contributions and setting
2800: 
2801: $$
2802: \beta_{\text{pc}} := \frac{1}{4 \Lambda t + 2}, \qquad
2803: C_{\text{pc}} := 2 e^{\beta_{\text{pc}} (2 C_{\text{bias}}(t))^2},
2804: $$
2805: 
2806: gives the claimed inequality. $\square$
2807: 
2808: **Connection to Section 4.3**: Taking $\epsilon = c_{\text{early}}$ in Proposition {prf:ref}`prop-poc-mass` furnishes the early-time mass floor used in Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-mass-lower-bound-high-prob`, thereby linking the discrete alive count $k_t/N$ to the continuum mass $\|\rho_t\|_{L^1}$ with exponentially high probability in $N$.
2809: 
2810: 
2811: 
2812: ### 5. Main Theorem: Bounded Density Ratio
2813: 
2814: We now assemble the results from Sections 2-4 into the main theorem.
2815: 
2816: :::{prf:theorem} Bounded Density Ratio for the Euclidean Gas (RIGOROUS)
2817: :label: thm-bounded-density-ratio-main
2818: 
2819: **Assumptions**:
2820: - Euclidean Gas dynamics with parameters $(\gamma, \sigma_v, \sigma_x, U, R)$ from `02_euclidean_gas.md`
2821: - Cloning position jitter $\sigma_x > 0$ (`03_cloning.md` line 6022)
2822: - Initial density $\|f_0\|_\infty \leq M_0 < \infty$
2823: - Number of walkers $N \geq N_0$ sufficiently large
2824: 
2825: Then there exists a finite constant $M = M(\gamma, \sigma_v, \sigma_x, U, R, M_0, N) < \infty$ such that:
2826: 
2827: $$
2828: \sup_{t \geq 0} \sup_{x \in \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}} \frac{d\tilde{\mu}_t}{d\tilde{\pi}_{\text{QSD}}}(x) \leq M
2829: 
2830: $$
2831: 
2832: where $\tilde{\mu}_t = \mu_t / \|\mu_t\|$ is the normalized empirical measure and $\tilde{\pi}_{\text{QSD}}$ is the normalized quasi-stationary distribution.
2833: 
2834: **Explicit Formula**:
2835: 
2836: $$
2837: M = \max(M_1, M_2) < \infty
2838: 
2839: $$
2840: 
2841: where:
2842: - $M_1 = \dfrac{C_{\text{hypo}}(M_0, T_0, \gamma, \sigma_v, \sigma_x, U, R)}{c_{\sigma_x, R} \cdot c_{\text{mass}}}$ is the **early-time bound** (Regime 1)
2843: - $M_2 = \dfrac{C_{\text{late}}^{\text{total}}}{c_{\sigma_x, R} \cdot c_{\text{mass}}}$ is the **late-time bound** (Regime 2)
2844: 
2845: **Component constants**:
2846: - $C_{\text{hypo}}$ is the hypoelliptic smoothing constant (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-linfty-full-operator`)
2847: - $C_{\text{late}}^{\text{total}} = C_\pi + C_{\text{late}}$ where $C_{\text{late}}$ is from the Nash-Aronson estimate (Lemmas {prf:ref}`lem-linearization-qsd`, {prf:ref}`lem-l1-to-linfty-near-qsd`)
2848: - $c_{\sigma_x, R} = (2\pi\sigma_x^2)^{-d/2} \exp(-(2R)^2 / (2\sigma_x^2))$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-gaussian-kernel-lower-bound`)
2849: - $c_{\text{mass}} = \min\!\left(c_{\text{early}}, \frac{m_{\text{eq}}}{2}\right)$ (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-mass-lower-bound-high-prob`)
2850: - $T_0 = O(\kappa_{\text{QSD}}^{-1})$ is the equilibration time
2851: 
2852: **Key Property**: Both $M_1$ and $M_2$ are finite and time-independent, yielding a uniform bound for all $t \geq 0$.
2853: 
2854: **Probability Statement**:
2855: - **Finite horizon**: For any fixed $T < \infty$, the bound holds with probability $\geq 1 - CT e^{-\delta N}$ for all $t \in [0, T]$.
2856: - **Infinite horizon (asymptotic)**: The bound holds **deterministically for all $t \geq 0$** on the survival event $\{\tau_\dagger = \infty\}$ (see Section 4.4).
